intro: Schizogyne glaberrima, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Schizogyne glaberrima is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
